Class DataSaveController

java.lang.Object
controller.BaseController
controller.DataSaveController
public class DataSaveController extends BaseController
Controller responsible for loading and saving repository CSV files from/to the configured base data directory.

This controller provides centralized data persistence management for all system entities, handling both save and load operations for:

  • Student records
  • Company representative accounts
  • Career center staff accounts
  • Internship postings
  • Internship applications
  • Withdrawal requests
The controller uses a configurable base directory for CSV file storage and automatically creates the directory structure if it doesn't exist. Operations continue even if individual repository operations fail, with comprehensive error reporting.

  • Constructor Details

    • DataSaveController

      public DataSaveController(StudentRepository students, CompanyRepRepository reps, CareerCenterStaffRepository staff, InternshipRepository internships, ApplicationRepository applications, WithdrawalRequestRepository withdrawals)
      Creates a DataSaveController using the default data directory `src/data`.

      The default directory will be created if it doesn't exist. If directory creation fails, a warning will be printed but initialization continues.

      Parameters:
      students - the student repository instance
      reps - the company representative repository instance
      staff - the career center staff repository instance
      internships - the internship repository instance
      applications - the internship application repository instance
      withdrawals - the withdrawal request repository instance

    • DataSaveController

      public DataSaveController(StudentRepository students, CompanyRepRepository reps, CareerCenterStaffRepository staff, InternshipRepository internships, ApplicationRepository applications, WithdrawalRequestRepository withdrawals, Path baseDir)
      Creates a DataSaveController with an explicit base directory for CSV files.

      The specified directory will be created if it doesn't exist. If directory creation fails, a warning will be printed but initialization continues. If the provided baseDir is null, the default directory `src/data` will be used.

      Parameters:
      students - the student repository instance
      reps - the company representative repository instance
      staff - the career center staff repository instance
      internships - the internship repository instance
      applications - the internship application repository instance
      withdrawals - the withdrawal request repository instance
      baseDir - the base directory path for CSV file storage, or null to use default

  • Method Details

    • saveAll

      public void saveAll(String studentsCsv, String repsCsv, String staffCsv, String internshipsCsv, String applicationsCsv, String withdrawalsCsv) throws IOException
      Saves all repositories to their respective CSV files under the base directory.

      Each repository is saved to a separate CSV file. The method attempts to save all repositories even if some operations fail, and collects all error messages into a single exception if any failures occur.

      Parameters:
      studentsCsv - the filename for student data (e.g., "students.csv")
      repsCsv - the filename for company representative data (e.g., "company_reps.csv")
      staffCsv - the filename for staff data (e.g., "staff.csv")
      internshipsCsv - the filename for internship data (e.g., "internships.csv")
      applicationsCsv - the filename for application data (e.g., "applications.csv")
      withdrawalsCsv - the filename for withdrawal request data (e.g., "withdrawals.csv")
      Throws:
      IOException - if any save operation fails, containing consolidated error messages from all failed operations

    • loadAll

      public void loadAll(String studentsCsv, String repsCsv, String staffCsv, String internshipsCsv, String applicationsCsv, String withdrawalsCsv) throws IOException
      Loads all repositories from their respective CSV files in the base directory.

      Each repository is loaded from a separate CSV file. If a file doesn't exist, a message is printed but loading continues for other files. The method attempts to load all repositories even if some operations fail, and collects all error messages into a single exception if any failures occur.

      Some repositories require dependencies for loading (e.g., applications need student and internship references), so repositories should be loaded in the correct order.

      Parameters:
      studentsCsv - the filename for student data (e.g., "students.csv")
      repsCsv - the filename for company representative data (e.g., "company_reps.csv")
      staffCsv - the filename for staff data (e.g., "staff.csv")
      internshipsCsv - the filename for internship data (e.g., "internships.csv")
      applicationsCsv - the filename for application data (e.g., "applications.csv")
      withdrawalsCsv - the filename for withdrawal request data (e.g., "withdrawals.csv")
      Throws:
      IOException - if any load operation fails, containing consolidated error messages from all failed operations

    • getBaseDir

      public Path getBaseDir()
      Returns the base directory path used for CSV file storage.
      Returns:
      the base directory path where CSV files are stored

    • isInitialized

      public boolean isInitialized()
      Checks if all repositories have been properly initialized.

      This method verifies that all repository instances are non-null, indicating that the controller is ready for data operations.

      Returns:
      true if all repositories are initialized, false otherwise
